abstract.p: John Tauranac, who created New York City subway map, has completed book Manhattan Block by Block (S)

block.p: Manhattan impresses with its skyline, but it reveals its secrets only to those who walk its streets. And John Tauranac is a man from whom Manhattan has little to hide.

Mr. Tauranac, creator of the wonderfully lucid New York City subway map, has come up with ''Manhattan Block by Block'' (Tauranac Maps, $14.95). The book is a street-level guide to the borough that points out landmarks like museums, hotels, Broadway theaters, playgrounds, schools, hospitals, parking garages and movie theaters.
Manhattan impresses with its skyline, but it reveals its secrets only to those who walk its streets. And John Tauranac is a man from whom Manhattan has little to hide.

Mr. Tauranac, creator of the wonderfully lucid New York City subway map, has come up with ''Manhattan Block by Block'' (Tauranac Maps, $14.95). The book is a street-level guide to the borough that points out landmarks like museums, hotels, Broadway theaters, playgrounds, schools, hospitals, parking garages and movie theaters.

Street numbers are listed for all of Manhattan -- broken down on 94 pages of maps. The book also has citywide subway maps, a Manhattan bus map, and highway and commuter-rail maps. For some light reading among the cartography, Mr. Tauranac has written chapters on the history of Manhattan's street grid and guides to its neighborhoods. The 172-page book, in a pocket-friendly 3 1/4-by-9-inch format, is a result of over three years of walking streets (or, in the case of highways and bridges, riding in a car). ''Manhattan Block by Block,'' distributed by Larry Winderbaum Inc., (212) 481-1588, is sold at bookstores, map stores and other outlets.
